title: Friends' Jennifer Aniston finally reveals full cast reunion dinner
text:
Jennifer joined social media with this epic selfie (Picture: Instagram)

Jennifer Aniston has finally joined the world of Instagram, sharing with us an insight into her recent Friends reunion.

The actress has wasted no time in giving the people what they want, as she shared a shot from a recent get together with her former sitcom co-stars as they gathered around her camera in a living room during recent celebrations.

Previously Courteney Cox (who played Monica) shared a shot of her hanging with Matt LeBlanc (Joey) and Jen (Rachel), as the three caught up.

We soon found out the whole cast, along with Matthew Perry (Chandler), David Schwimmer (Ross) and Lisa Kudrow (Phoebe) were also present, hiding on the other side of the lens.

From her freshly verified account on Tuesday afternoon, Jen wrote alongside a very, very swell selfie: ‘And now we’re Instagram FRIENDS too. HI INSTAGRAM 👋🏻’

Turns out it’s actually really hard to fit six people into a selfie…

She’d been creeping around the traps earlier on after joining, commenting on Matt’s recent post about the show’s 25th anniversary.

Jen playfully quipped: ‘You don’t have to # me anymore,’ referencing the fact both her and Matthew Perry’s non-existent accounts meant they were mere hashtags within mentions.

Despite only just joining, the Murder Mystery actress has amassed over 45,300 followers on Instagram. She’s also following a whole bunch of legends, including ex-husband Justin Theroux.

And it only seems fair she posted a shot to her new friends, with a bunch of her old ones – which comes after she revealed they’d all caught up recently.

We’ll never let go (Picture: Getty Images)

‘We had dinner, the whole gang. Everyone was there,’ she told Howard Stern on his SiriusXM radio show last week.

After she was asked whether it was rare for them to all get together, she insisted: ‘It’s just Schwimmer was in town, we all happened to have a window of time, so we all got together.’

She said they all miss the show and spent their evening ‘laughing so hard’ as we all curse the fact we weren’t flies on the wall.

‘We went to Courteney’s. Nobody got naked, it was very civilised. But we just laughed a lot,’ she said, before adding of Friends: ‘We all miss it every day.’

Of course she was asked whether there would be a reunion, 25 years after the show premiered, and while she said she ‘would be nothing without it’, Jen was hesitant to confirm they were getting back together.

‘I honestly think…we would love it…there is an idea if there is a reboot of the show it won’t be even close to as good as what it was. It would ruin it,’ she said, agreeing the legacy of the show was important.

Speaking of the iconic salaries they received – reportedly topping $1million (£818,000) per episode towards the end – Jen spoke about the group of six’s fight for parity.

‘We stood as a solidary unit and asked for equal pay,’ she said. ‘We were leading the charge, ahead of our time.’

Welcome to Instagram, Jennifer! We think you’ll be very happy here.
